title: Plant Characteristics to Avoid
brief: Recognize common plant features that indicate potential toxicity to avoid during food gathering.
steps: Step 1: Avoid plants with milky or discolored sap.
Step 2: Avoid plants with beans, bulbs, or seeds inside pods.
Step 3: Avoid plants with bitter or soapy taste.
Step 4: Avoid plants with spines, fine hairs, or thorns.
Step 5: Avoid plants with dill, carrot, parsnip, or parsley-like foliage.
Step 6: Avoid plants with 'almond' scent in woody parts and leaves.
Step 7: Avoid grain heads with pink, purplish, or black spurs.
Step 8: Avoid plants with three-leaved growth pattern.
warnings: These criteria will eliminate some edible plants but help avoid potentially deadly ones.
Almond scent indicates cyanide compounds which can be fatal.
Three-leaved pattern often indicates poison ivy family plants.
source: FM21-76 US Army Survival Manual — U.S. Department of the Army
